Digital lending apps cannot access mobile contacts or gallery without explicit consent.
Lenders must disclose all charges, APR, and recovery terms upfront.
Loan disbursal and repayment must occur only between borrower and regulated lender accounts.
Digital lending apps must be linked to a regulated NBFC or Bank.
Credit limits cannot be increased without explicit user consent.
Borrowers must get a cooling-off/exit period without penalty.
Apps cannot use aggressive or abusive recovery practices.
Data collected must be minimal, purpose-specific, and not shared without consent.
Borrowers must receive Key Fact Statements digitally.
Apps must show valid customer support details and grievance contacts.
Digital lending platforms must store data in India unless allowed.
Lenders must follow RBI's Fair Practices Code.
UPI users must never share OTP, UPI PIN, or passwords.
Suspicious KYC or SIM-update links must be treated as fraud.
Unknown UPI collect requests should be declined unless verified.
Banks must allow instant blocking/dispute raising for fraud.
Multi-factor authentication is mandatory for digital payments.
Apps cannot auto-initiate transactions without user action.
Fake refund/reward scams are RBI-identified fraud patterns.
Banks must report major digital fraud cases to RBI.
Investment advisors cannot promise guaranteed returns.
Trading apps must show risk disclosures.
Unregistered tip providers are banned by SEBI.
Apps cannot misuse or share KYC data.
Investors must verify platforms in SEBI's registered list.
